name: places/ChIJf-rNJPhbwokR_INQ89W6avk
formattedAddress: 92 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 92 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: I was initially just looking for a gym downtown that offered beginner level Muay Thai classes, as I had an experience at another gym where I felt like I was lacking that focus on fundamentals, but I didn’t realize just how great Workshop would be. I think the caliber of the instructors, attention to detail, welcoming environment, and investment in each student’s development makes it a really special place to train. I came into Muay Thai and BJJ intimidated as someone with no experience, but Rich, Gianna, Jin, and Chris each went out of their way as coaches to make me feel comfortable and safe, while still pushing me to be better. They’re experts in what they do, and on top of that they're phenomenal teachers who can explain things in a way that makes sense to a day one beginner (and I know I can always ask questions if I didn’t get something initially). The gym has fostered a warm, easygoing, welcoming community overall (with a good amount of women at that!), from novices to actual fighters, who are all equally eager to help you thrive. Everyone has such a deep respect and love for the sport, and it’s truly infectious, to the point where something feels off the days I don’t go into train. Vibes are great. Can’t recommend Workshop enough.

originalText.text:
I joined workshop NYC in March of last year and have had an overwhelmingly positive experience.  Workshop is a great place for women (or anyone who dislikes a toxic gym environment) to train - no one is allowed to act like a creep and safety is prioritized. The people that train here are kind and supportive towards beginners, even if they’ve got years of experience on you.

The commitment to quality instruction  creates a lot of value. I’ve taken classes with Gianna, Jin, Rich and Chris - they’ve all been great. The instructors are always attentive and take the time to correct you, even if the class is at capacity.

Can’t recommend highly enough!

originalText.text: Great gym with decent teachers and very supportive community. I joined to learn self-defense to overcome my fear, and it’s been truly helpful both physically and psychologically. Now it is more like a playground than a gym, I enjoy every time. Works for any levels. Always very clean too! :)

Now it is more like a playground than a gym, I enjoy every time. Works for any levels. Always very clean too! :)

originalText.text: Far and away the best jiu jitsu gym I have ever trained at. Jin's instruction is peerlessly consistent and effective. The space is big and clean. Uniquely emphasizes wrestling and judo in the curriculum. The community is welcoming and diverse. Can't speak for the Muay Thai program but Gianna and Rich train champions. Free weights and kettlebell classes are just the cherry on top. Couldn't imagine training anywhere else.

text.text: Far and away the best jiu jitsu gym I have ever trained at. Jin's instruction is peerlessly consistent and effective. The space is big and clean. Free weights and kettlebell classes are just the cherry on top. Couldn't imagine training anywhere else.

originalText.text:
Gianna is a great instructor who takes her time to watch and correct the form of her students. She optimizes innovative Muay Thai technique with traditional Muay Thai technique and really focuses on the beauty of the art. If you appreciate the aesthetic and function of combat, this is the place for you. Workshop is extremely beginner friendly, and a great place to learn pure fundamentals.

Great atmosphere, awesome instruction, and a wonderful place to express yourself and gain confidence through Muay Thai and Jiu Jitsu.
